meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dull or lacking in brightness or sharpness.
meanings.sent1: The dulnesses of the old painting made it hard to see the details.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with dulnesses, making it feel gloomy and uninviting.
meanings.sent3: The dulnesses of the lecture put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed with dulnesses, as if she had lost all emotion.
meanings.sent5: The dulnesses of the winter sky made everything seem gray and lifeless.

meanings.definition: The quality of being boring or uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: The dulnesses of the movie made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: His speech was filled with dulnesses, causing many to yawn.
meanings.sent3: The dulnesses of the book made it a struggle to finish.
meanings.sent4: Her jokes were met with dulnesses, no one even cracked a smile.
meanings.sent5: The dulnesses of the meeting made it feel like time was standing still.
